text: Suppose I have a template (A) which makes use of a partial (B) to take care of the `<head>` and maybe a standard header with nav. In the partial (B), I have specified css files which are being used site-wide. If I then want to include a css file to be used in template (A) which is specific to this template, is there a means within the `html + hubl` to do this? In other words, is there a means at this point to inject another stylesheet into the `<head>` ?

How would I take global content from one blog template and add it to another blog template?
I am looking to move the primary navigation and logo that was created through the global-content-editor WYSIWYG to a different template. These contents seem to be theme specific as they are modified whenever I change the `settings => website => blog => Template for blog posts` setting and revisit the blog post
I have fetched the theme through the CMS CLI, opened up the project in an IDE, and searched the project for said global content, though no results are found
